title: Israel’s Unworthiness and God’s Grace
summary: Deuteronomy 9 warns Israel not to think they deserve the land because of their righteousness. Moses reminds them of their past rebellions, including the golden calf, and how he interceded for them before God.

faq.question: Why was Israel receiving the land of Canaan?
faq.answer: Because of God’s promise and the wickedness of the nations—not because of Israel’s righteousness.

faq.question: What example does Moses use to show Israel’s rebellion?
faq.answer: The golden calf incident at Mount Sinai.
